question: If $f(x)=|\begin{matrix}x-3&2x^{2}-18&2x^{3}-81\\ x-5&2x^{2}-50&4x^{3}-500\\ 1&2&3&\end{matrix}|$ then f(1).f(3)+f(3).f(5)+f(5).f(1) is
explanation: This question is marked as Bonus in the answer key, likely due to a typo in the determinant's entries (e.g., $2x^3-81$ vs $2(x^3-27)$) preventing a straightforward evaluation. Standard evaluation leads to a complex polynomial.
